biolockj

Class BioLockJ

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.BioLockJ

  • public class BioLockJ
extends Object
    This is the primary BioLockJ class - its main() method is executed when the jar is run.
    This class validates the runtime parameters to run a new pipeline or restart a failed pipeline.
    The Java log file is initialized and the configuration file is processed before starting the pipeline.
    If the pipeline is successful, the program executes clean up operations (if configured) and creates a status-complete indicator file in the pipeline root directory.

      • isPipelineComplete

        public static boolean isPipelineComplete()
        Determine project status based on existence of "biolockjComplete" in pipeline root directory.
        Returns:
        true if "biolockjComplete" exists in the pipeline root directory, otherwise false

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        BioLockJ is the BioLockj.jar Main-Class, and is the first method executed.
        Execution summary:
        1. Call initBioLockJ(String[]) to assign pipeline root dir and log file
        2. If change password pipeline, call Email.encryptAndStoreEmailPassword()
        3. Otherwise execute startPipeline()

        If pipeline has failed, attempt execute Email (if configured) to notify user of failures.

        Parameters:
        args - - String[] runtime parameters passed to the Java program when launching BioLockJ

      • pipelineInputDir

        public static File pipelineInputDir()
                             throws Exception
        Return the pipeline input directory
        Returns:
        Input dir
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to obtain file

      • copyInputData

        protected static void copyInputData()
                             throws Exception
        Create a copy of the sequence files in property "input.dirPaths", output to a directory named "pipeline.pipelineDir"/input.
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to copy the files

      • createPipelineDirectory

        protected static File createPipelineDirectory()
                                       throws Exception
        Create the pipeline root directory under $DOCKER_PROJ and save the path to Config."pipeline.pipelineDir".

        For example, the following Config settings will create: /projects/MicrobeProj_2018Jan01

        • $DOCKER_PROJ = /projects
        • Config file name = MicrobeProj.properties
        • Current date = January 1, 2018
        Returns:
        Pipeline root directory
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • initAwsManager

        protected static void initAwsManager()
                              throws Exception
        Initialize AWS manager pipeline:
        1. Build Nexflow main.nf
        2. Run ImportMetadata module
        3. Set files editable
        4. Update pipeline root directory to EFS directory
        5. Update EFS MASTER Config with new pipeline root directory path
        6. Save pipeline input files to EFS for faster processing
        Throws:
        Exception - if runtime errors occur

      • initBioLockJ

        protected static void initBioLockJ(String[] args)
                            throws Exception
        Execution summary:
        1. Call MemoryUtil.reportMemoryUsage(String) for baseline memory info
        2. Call RuntimeParamUtil.registerRuntimeParameters(String[])
        3. Call MetaUtil.initialize() to verify metadata dependencies
        4. Call Config.initialize() to create pipeline root dir and load properties
        5. Initialize Log with /resources/log4J.properties
        6. Copy initial metadata file into the pipeline root directory
        7. Call SeqUtil.initialize() to set Config parameters based on sequence files

        Parameters:
        args - - String[] runtime parameters passed to the Java program when launching BioLockJ
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • initRestart

        protected static void initRestart()
                           throws Exception
        Initialize restarted pipeline by:
        1. Initialize Log file using the name of the pipeline root directory
        2. Update summary #Attempts count
        3. Delete status file "biolockjFailed" in pipeline root directory
        4. If pipeline status = "biolockjComplete"
        5. Delete file "downloadList.txt" in pipeline root directory
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • markProjectStatus

        protected static void markProjectStatus(String status)
        Create indicator file in pipeline root directory, with name = status parameter. Config."pipeline.pipelineDir".
        Parameters:
        status - Status indicator file name

      • removeTempFiles

        protected static void removeTempFiles()
                               throws Exception
        Delete all BioModule/"temp" folders.
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to delete temp files

      • startPipeline

        protected static void startPipeline()
                             throws Exception
        Execution summary:
        1. Call Pipeline.initializePipeline() to initialize Pipeline modules
        2. For direct module execution call Pipeline.runDirectModule(Integer)
        3. Otherwise execute Pipeline.runPipeline() and save MASTER Config
        4. If initializing AWS Cloud manager, call initAwsManager().
        5. If Config."pipeline.deleteTempFiles" = "Y", Call removeTempFiles() to delete tem files
        6. Call markProjectStatus(String) to set the overall pipeline status as successful
        Throws:
        Exception - if runtime errors occur
